param.name: email_admin
param.label: Send Email Report
param.description: Whether or not you want Feed Gator to send a report to an administrator after each import run with details of the processing. This is useful for continuous 'hands-free' monitoring of automated inport runs.

param.name: admin_email
param.label: Admin Email Address
param.description: The email address of the administrator who should receive import reports. This can be a person assigned specifically to monitor the flow of RSS content through your site.

param.name: email_subject
param.label: Email Subject
param.description: The text that should be displayed in the subject line of email reports sent to the Feed Gator administrator. You can customize this to work with your email filters and rules.

param.name: html_email
param.label: HTML Email
param.description: Whether or not you want the import report sent in HTML format...Try it, the HTML email is nice and colorful, and easy to read :)

param.name: force_fsockopen
param.label: Force fsockopen
param.description: The SimplePie parser that Feed Gator uses does not run well on some PHP5.x configurations. If that happens on your server set this option to enabled. If it works ok leave this option disabled.

param.name: use_sp_cache
param.label: Use SimplePie Cache
param.description: Set this option to 1 if You want to enable SimplePie feeds cache.

param.name: show_orig_link
param.label: Show Trackback Link
param.description: Whether or not you wish to display a link to the originating site in your content items. Displaying the link is generally considered proper etiquitte, and may even be a requirement for using some feeds.

param.name: show_html
param.label: Show HTML Content
param.description: Whether or not you wish to add html tags to content items (something flash objects or images)

param.name: strip_html_tags
param.label: Strip HTML tags
param.description: Whether or not you wish to strip html tags

param.name: orig_link_text
param.label: Trackback Link Text
param.description: The text you would like to display for the link to the originating site. Maybe something like 'Full Story...', or if you're using the verbose option something like 'Read more at:'. With the verbose option, the full URL to the original content will follow the link text, but only the URL will be hyper-linked.

param.name: target_frame
param.label: Target Frame
param.description: The target frame for Trackback Links. The default of 'None' means links will be opened in the current window. In a modern standards compliant and accessible world, it is considered bad form to open links in new windows.

param.name: custom_frame
param.label: Custom Frame
param.description: The name of a custom frame that Trackback Links should open into. This option has no effect unless Target Frame above is set to 'Custom'.

param.name: auto_publish
param.label: Publish Content Automatically
param.description: Whether or not content should be set to published status immmediately when it is imported. Use this along with the publish duration parameter below to automate the flow of syndicated content through your site.

param.name: publish_days
param.label: Publish Duration (days)
param.description: The number of days each content item should remain published. If you set this to 0 or leave it blank, content items will remain published indefinitely. This parameter has no effect if automatic publishing is disabled.

param.name: save_author
param.label: Save Author Alias
param.description: If set to yes then Feed Gator will look for an 'author' or 'creator' tag on your feeds and save the data in the author_alias field of your content. Not many feeds include this value, however, so if you don't want the author_alias field to be blank, use one of the parameters below. If this option is set to no, then neither of the next two options will have any effect.

param.name: missing_author
param.label: If Author is Missing
param.description: What to do in the likely event that an author is not associated with the feed. According to the RSS2.0 specification, all feeds are required to include a 'Title'. Set this option to 'Use Title' if you want Feed Gator to use the feed title as the author_alias on content items that don't specify an author, otherwise choose 'Use Default' and enter a value below (or you can leave it blank).

param.name: compute_tags
param.label: Compute Meta Tags
param.description: Whether or not meta tags should be extracted from the text of RSS feed content and stored as meta keywords with your content items. There are two types of meta tag computation: 1. The default, which uses a simple word frequency algorithm to compute mete tags, and 2. Yahoo Term Extraction (see below).

param.name: use_yahoo_te
param.label: Use Yahoo Term Extraction
param.description: If set to yes then Feed Gator will use the Yahoo API to analyze and extract relevant terms from RSS content and save them as tags (meta keywords). Relevant terms can be single words or complete phrases, and this method may provide a more effective analysis of feed content than the default word extraction algorithm. This is the recommended meta tag computation method. If this is set to no then the default word extraction is used. To use this feature you MUST PROVIDE A VALID APPLICATION ID (see below). This parameter has no effect if meta tag computation is not enabled.

param.name: yahoo_app_id
param.label: Your Yahoo Application ID
param.description: Your unique Yahoo Application ID is required to use the term extraction feature. A temporary ID is provided with this component to allow you to test it, but you are STRONGLY ADVISED to obtain your own App ID, because there are limits on the volume of requests that one App ID can make to Yahoo. Getting an App ID is free, very easy and instantaneous: http://api.search.yahoo.com/webservices/register_application The temporary ID I've provided is registered in my name, and if I find that people are abusing it, I will disable it - you have been warned!

param.name: max_tags
param.label: Max Number of Tags
param.description: The maximum number of tags (meta keywords) to save with your content items. The most relevant N tags are saved (Where N is the number you enter here). This parameter has no effect if meta tag computation is disabled. Leave this blank or set to 0 to save all possible tags, although this would probably be a bad idea.

param.name: min_tag_chars
param.label: Min Characters in Tags
param.description: The minimum number of characters a tag must contain. Larger numbers here might improve the quality and significance of the tags stored with your data. This only has an effect if Compute Meta Tags is enabled.

param.name: use_ignore_list
param.label: Use Ignore List
param.description: Whether or not to use the built-in ignore words list. The default ignore words list contains the 250 most common English words. Enabling the use of the ignore list can improve the quality of your meta tags by excluding common words. The excluded words list currently cannot be easily edited - this will be improved in a future version.

param.name: ignore_list
param.label: Ignore List
param.description: List of ignore words, use comma as delimitter

param.name: save_feed_cats
param.label: Save Feed Categories
param.description: Some RSS feeds include Subject or Category data for their content. If this parameter is set to yes then Feed Gator will save the categorical information in the feed as tags (meta keywords) with your content items. The parameter is independent of the 'Compute Meta Tags' parameter - one or the other, both, or neither may be enabled, and category tags are not included in the Max Number of Tags parameter above.

param.name: save_sect_cats
param.label: Save Section/Category
param.description: Set this to yes if you want to store your Joomla section and category names as tags in your imported content. This is similar to the feature found on the Edit Content page of Joomla, except the Feed Gator does not store the Title. This parameter is independent of the 'Compute Meta Tags' parameter - one or the other, both, or neither may be enabled, and category tags are not included in the Max Number of Tags parameter above.
